module.name: project_management_resource_information
module.keywords: management resource information, module, project management

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the assignment of project management resource information to project management resource data.

inscope.li: facility to assign approval information to project management resource data;
facility to assign certificate information to project management resource data;
facility to assign classification information to project management resource data;
facility to assign condition and condition relationships information to project management resource data;
facility to assign contract information to project management resource data;
facility to assign date and time interval information to project management resource data;
facility to assign document information to project management resource data;
facility to assign effectivity information to project management resource data;
facility to assign file information to project management resource data;
facility to assign identification information to project management resource data;
facility to assign independent property information to project management resource data;
facility to assign justification information to project management resource data;
facility to assign location information to project management resource data;
facility to assign language information to project management resource data;
facility to assign person and organization information to project management resource data;
facility to assign product information to project management resource data;
facility to assign project information to project management resource data;
facility to assign representation information to project management resource data;
facility to assign security information to project management resource data;
facility to assign value with unit information to project management resource data.

usage_guide.p: The problem of creating extensible type lists has proven to be an extreme challenge. A publish and subscribe analogy is used to explain the approach used.

Schemas enable information modelling capability within a domain. The capabilities are enabled by entities. Entities use other entities directly as specified attributes or less directly via extensible select types. The associated extensible select type list can be viewed as a subscription list. The list itself contains all entity names associated with entitiy concepts that subscribe to the capability offered by the schema containing the entity that uses the extensible type list as an attribute.

The complexity of the extensible select type list specification problem stems from the fact that lists are relative to a sub-domain of the domain associated with the schema that defines the extensible type list.
This creates a list creation problem that is 3 dimensional. The coordinate axes are:

ul.li: domain specified by all USE FROM schemas,
extensible select types defined within this domain,
entities defined within a sub-domain of this domain.

usage_guide.p: To size this, AP233 has about 10 major domains, 1000 entities and 100 extensible types. If one does not apply some organizational logic to the problem this implies a yes/no cognitive decisions space containing 1,000,000 points.

In order to penetrate this problem some logical approach that is both scalable and checkable is required. In AP233 WD1 all schemas where grouped into high level concept groups: program management resource information (pmri), organization structure (os), project breakdown (pb). schedule (ss) and work structure (ws). As AP233 WD2 evolved major module restructuring occurred and the ability to group at a more detail level of abstraction was enabled.
The Project_management_resource_information_arm module contains the type extend lists relative to extensible select types defined within the following modules and those that they inherit:
The USE FROM connectivity associated with the module that enables project management resource and select item information are shown below in Figure 1 the Project concept map.
The USE FROM connectivity associated with the module that enables schedule information is shown below in Figure 2 the Schedule concept map.
The USE FROM connectivity associated with the module that enable position in organization information is shown below in Figure 3 the Who concept map.
The USE FROM connectivity associated with the module that enable documentation information are shown below in Figure 4 the Who concept map.
The USE FROM connectivity associated with the module that enable external class information are shown below in Figure 5 the Representation concept map.
The entities defined within the Project management resource information type extend lists are obtained from the following modules:

From the perspective of information cross coupling; the type extend lists identify within this module specifiy how all project management resource information modeling concepts defined within the schemas of the project management resource information domain are coupled together via type extends within the project management resource information domain.
